intro: Xenostegia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed xenostegia, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant features opposite, trifoliate leaves with three distinct leaflets, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical berries. Xenostegia tridentata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
